properties.description: Martin Luther King Jr. was born on January 15, 1929, in Atlanta, Georgia.
King graduated from Morehouse College with a Bachelor of Arts in Sociology.
King graduated from Crozer Theological Seminary in Chester, Pennsylvania, with a Bachelor of Divinity.
King married Coretta Scott on June 18, 1953, in Marion, Alabama.
King led the Montgomery Bus Boycott from December 5, 1955, to December 20, 1956, in Montgomery, Alabama.
King delivered his famous 'I Have a Dream' speech during the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom on August 28, 1963.
King was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize on October 14, 1964, in Oslo, Norway.
King led the Selma to Montgomery marches in Alabama, which were crucial in the passage of the Voting Rights Act of 1965.
King was assassinated on April 4, 1968, in Memphis, Tennessee.
Malcolm X was born on May 19, 1925, in Omaha, Nebraska.
Malcolm X was sentenced to prison for larceny and breaking and entering. He served time at various prisons including Charlestown State Prison in Massachusetts.
Malcolm X was released from prison and joined the Nation of Islam.
Malcolm X married Betty Sanders (later known as Betty Shabazz) on January 14, 1958, in Lansing, Michigan.
Malcolm X made his pilgrimage to Mecca, Saudi Arabia, which was a transformative experience in his life.

properties.event: Founding of Organization of Afro-American Unity
properties.description: Malcolm X founded the Organization of Afro-American Unity (OAAU) in New York City.
Malcolm X was assassinated on February 21, 1965, in New York City during a speech at the Audubon Ballroom.
